text.__SUMMARY__: Quercus auricoma is the accepted name of a tree species in the Asian sub-genus of 'ring-cupped oaks' and the family Fagaceae; there are no known subspecies.This oak tree grows up to 30 m. tall and has orange-brown twigs. Leaves can be as much as 120 mm long; the acorns are "hemispherical".  This species has been recorded from southern China (Guangdong, Guangxi, Hunan: a.k.a. Cyclobalanopsis hui) and Vietnam (in the Bạch Mã area): where it may be called sồi tóc vàng.
text.External links: Line drawings: Flora of China Illustrations vol. 4, fig. 376, drawings 1-3 at lower left
